pricing_psychology.avoid_percentage_fees: Display advertising clients resist percentage-of-spend pricing because it creates misaligned incentives - they fear you'll encourage higher spend for higher fees. Use flat fees or performance tiers instead.
pricing_psychology.anchor_on_waste: Show how much they're currently wasting (typical: 40-60% of display budget is inefficient). Your fee becomes small compared to waste eliminated. '$3K/month saves you $8K in wasted spend.'
pricing_psychology.performance_tiers: Base fee for management + performance bonuses at ROAS milestones (3x, 4x, 5x). Aligns incentives and reduces perceived risk. 'You only pay more when you're making more.'
pricing_psychology.audit_to_contract: Offer paid audit ($500-1500) that's credited toward first month if they sign. Demonstrates value immediately, pre-qualifies serious buyers, creates sunk cost commitment.
pricing_psychology.minimum_spend_requirement: Require minimum ad spend ($5K-10K/month) to filter out small clients and position as premium. 'Display advertising requires scale to generate statistical significance for optimization.'
pricing_psychology.setup_fee_separate: Charge one-time setup fee ($2K-5K) separate from monthly management. Covers initial research, creative development, pixel implementation. Makes monthly fee seem more reasonable.
pricing_psychology.compare_to_hiring: Position against cost of hiring in-house ($80K+ salary + tools + training). Your $4K/month is 'a senior display specialist for 1/15th the cost.'
pricing_psychology.money_back_guarantee: Offer 60-90 day performance guarantee. If ROAS doesn't hit [X], refund management fees. Shows confidence, reduces risk perception, few clients actually claim it.

thread_structure: 7 display ad mistakes that scream 'amateur' (I've made them all): 🧵
1/ Using the same creative for 6+ months. Your audience is blind to it. Refresh every 4-6 weeks minimum.
2/ Not excluding mobile apps. 90% of app inventory is garbage. Whitelist only or prepare to waste budget.
3/ Ignoring frequency caps. Showing the same ad 50x doesn't work. 3-5 impressions per week is the sweet spot.
4/ Bidding on awareness for direct response goals. Match your bid strategy to your actual objective.
5/ Setting and forgetting. Display requires weekly optimization. Monthly reviews = leaving money on the table.
6/ Only running one ad size. Responsive display ads cover 90% of inventory. Use them.
7/ No landing page alignment. Your ad promises one thing, page delivers another. Conversion killer.

thread_structure: The anatomy of a perfect display ad campaign in 2024 (bookmark this): 🧵
1/ STRUCTURE: Separate campaigns by funnel stage. Awareness (cold) | Consideration (warm) | Conversion (hot). Never mix.
2/ TARGETING: Cold = contextual + affinity. Warm = remarketing + similar audiences. Hot = customer match + high-intent.
3/ CREATIVE: 3-5 variations per campaign. Video > animated > static. Test monthly. Kill underperformers ruthlessly.
4/ BIDDING: Awareness = vCPM. Consideration = CPC. Conversion = CPA/ROAS. Match strategy to goal or fail.
5/ FREQUENCY: Cap at 3-5 per week for cold, 7-10 for warm, unlimited for hot (last 7 days only).
6/ PLACEMENTS: Start broad, exclude aggressively. Whitelist winners. Review weekly minimum.
7/ MEASUREMENT: Track view-through conversions, time lag, path length. Attribution isn't linear.
8/ OPTIMIZATION: Weekly creative refresh check, daily budget pacing, monthly strategic pivot. Stay aggressive.
